sentences.english: Western officials seem glumly reconciled to another term for Mr Karzai.
sentences.chinese: 西方官员似乎对卡尔扎伊的连任感到闷闷不乐。

sentences.english: You must rid yourself of this gloomy mood.
sentences.chinese: 你必须使自己摆脱这种闷闷不乐的忧郁情绪。

sentences.english: M enters the room and sees that BYJ sitting on a sofa and looks worried.
sentences.chinese: 走进房间看到勇俊坐在沙发上闷闷不乐。

sentences.english: Get on with life and don't sit back and mope .
sentences.chinese: 活跃一些享受生活，不要闲呆着闷闷不乐的。

sentences.english: He moped in the house all day.
sentences.chinese: 他整天闷闷不乐地呆在屋里。

sentences.english: You are day and night oppressed with the sting of iniquity for the crimes and wanton cruelties you have committed.
sentences.chinese: 您整日闷闷不乐是因为您惨无人道，作恶多端。

sentences.english: Often this leads us to spend hours moping and falling in to depression.
sentences.chinese: 这会导致我们很长时间闷闷不乐或情绪沮伤。

sentences.english: He was hipped for losing his purse.
sentences.chinese: 他因丢了钱包而闷闷不乐。

sentences.english: Poor John has been moping the whole week away, I'm getting quite worried about him.
sentences.chinese: 可怜的约翰整个星期都闷闷不乐，我真十分替他担心。
“哦，”她闷闷不乐地说，“是你们两个。”

sentences.english: Stop moping and start making your own motivation.
sentences.chinese: 别闷闷不乐了，马上给自己找一些动力。

sentences.english: Every time I saw or talked to Mother I was heartsick.
sentences.chinese: 每次看到母亲或者与母亲聊天，我都闷闷不乐。
他看上去有点闷闷不乐的样子。

sentences.english: A fit of the sullen got short shrift in our house.
sentences.chinese: 在我们家里，闷闷不乐是不会有人搭理你的。

sentences.english: If I take the away or it breaks, he is unhappy.
sentences.chinese: 如果我拿走甜饼或者是小甜饼碎了，他就闷闷不乐。

definition: listless/dispirited/washed out/also written 沒精打彩|没精打彩
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
to be preoccupied (idiom)/to be inattentive/to be frightened out of one's mind
long moan and short gasp (idiom); continually moaning and groaning in pain
dull and colorless (idiom); lacking vitality/not lively
